context: The Finnish word 'tavata' is a verb that means to meet or encounter someone. It's commonly used when arranging meetings with people, whether in social or professional contexts. The conjugation changes depending on the subject: minä tapaan (I meet), sinä tapaat (you meet), hän tapaa (he/she/it meets), me tapamme (we meet), te tapaatte (you plural/meet/formal meeting), he tapavat (they meet).
